also used metaphorically for mental attitude or interest.', 'Angle - the space between two intersecting lines or surfaces at which one of them appears to diverge from the other.', 'Ascend - to rise or walk upward, though not strictly obliquely in a horizontal plane.', 'Slash - to move across (a surface) with sharp, diagonal strokes; can also refer to cutting through something diagonally.', 'Undulate - to move with smooth wavelike motions and curves, often implying an indirect path.', 'Cradle - while typically referring to a horizontal movement or motion of rocking gently back and forth, it can also describe an oblique diagonal movement in a figurative sense.', 'Dip - to go downward at a slant; often used metaphorically for decline.', 'Proceed - to begin moving forward or onward along a particular route, which may be obliquely relative to a straight line.', 'Creep - to move slowly and quietly in an oblique manner, typically downhill.', 'Meander - to follow a winding course; metaphorically speaking, this could involve walking or moving obliquely.', 'Drift - to be carried along by currents of air or water, implying indirect movement.', 'Wander - to move erratically from place to place without any specific direction; can include diagonal or oblique movements.', 'Slink - to move stealthily and smoothly in a slanted manner; often connotes an undesired or sneaky action.', 'Dangle - while typically referring to something hanging loosely, it could be interpreted as moving in an oblique manner if seen metapromptically.', 'Snake-crawl - to move slowly and with a sinuous or winding motion; implies walking in an indirect pathway.', 'Bend - to curve from one direction to another, which may include obliquely if not straight.', 'Diverge - to separate or go in different directions; while typically used for more literal purposes, could metaphorically describe a figurative departure at an angle.']
